page.topic: Getting Started with Alpha Anywhere Tutorials

description.p: *[[Installing Alpha Anywhere]]*
Don't have Alpha Anywhere installed? No problem. The Installation Guide describes how to install Alpha Anywhere.

section.title: Building Mobile Applications
section.description: Experience how simple it is to go from Install to Deploy with Alpha Anywhere. Follow these step-by-step guides to build your first mobile application with Alpha Anywhere.

description.p: *[[Build Your First Mobile App]]*

Build a Mobile Application that interacts with the Northwind database, an Access database that ships with Alpha Anywhere. You will learn how to build connection strings to interact with SQL databases and the basic building blocks of mobile applications in Alpha Anywhere. When you complete this tutorial, you will have a mobile application that is ready to deploy using PhoneGap Build.
*[[Build the Sample Mobile Application]]*
In this tutorial we will show you, step-by-step, how to create the sample mobile application that ships with Alpha Anywhere.

section.title: Building Web Applications
section.description: Experience how simple it is to go from Install to Deploy with Alpha Anywhere. Follow these step-by-step guides to build your first web application with Alpha Anywhere.

description.p: *[[Building Your First Web Application]]*

Get a flying start to building your first web application with Alpha Anywhere's Flying Start Genie. In this tutorial, you'll build a web application with a Tabbed UI interface that can be used to manage data in the Northwind database, an Access database that ships with Alpha Anywhere. You will learn how the Flying Start Genie can be used to quickly get started building a web application. You will also learn how to add action javascript for opening grid components and how to create a UX component as an alternative interface for editing records in a Grid.

section.title: Alpha Anywhere Basics
section.description: Learn some of the basic concepts in Alpha Anywhere that are key to building successful mobile and web applications.

description.p: *[[Creating a New Workspace]]*
Every Alpha Anywhere application begins with a new workspace. Learn how to create a new workspace for creating a web or mobile application.
*[[Creating an AlphaADO Connection String]]*

Nearly every business application needs to interact with a database. Alpha Anywhere appliactions can communicate with a wide variate of databases using AlphaDAO connection strings. AlphaDAO stands for "Alpha Anywhere Data Access Object". Using AlphaDAO connection strings, you can perform Create, Read, Update, and Delete (CRUD) on a wide variety of SQL databases. Follow this tutorial to learn how to create an Access, MySQL, or SQL Server connection string.

section.title: Publishing and Testing
section.description: These short guides explain some of the tools availalbe for publishing your application to the local webroot and testing your components before you deploy.

description.p: *[[The Development Server]]*

The Development Server is required to view an application published to the local webroot. It is also required if you wish to perform a Live Preview or Remote Teset of your application. This guild walks you through setting up the Alpha Anywhere Development Server to run in your development environment.
*[[Publishing to the Local Webroot]]*

A publishing profile defines where your web application is published. This guide teaches you how to create a publishing profile to publish your project to the local webroot. When you complete this tutorial, you will know how to publish and test your web projects on your develompent machine.
*[[Working and Live Preview]]*
Components can be tested and viewed using the Working Preview and Live Preview. Learn the difference between these two tools and how they can help you design and build Alpha Anywhere applications.
*[[Remote Testing]]*

Remote Test allows you to run your application on another device, such as a smartphone or tablet, that is connected to the same network as your computer. This step-by-step guide walks you through creating a Remote Test.
